div.p: O67/7435, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Yesterday when meeting the hon. W. Vale, I pointed out the desirability of entrusting me with the completion of the earth approach at the southern extremity of the iron Yarra bridge, in order that the descent from it to the Garden might be finished in time for planting of this season. The honorable Gentleman desired me to communicate with you and thus I beg to bring the subject under your consideration. I believe a special sum is available from the bridge vote for the earth work of the approach, and if this sum was placed at my disposal I would expend it simply in daily wages and direct the work myself, by which measure the office of public works would be entirely relieved of the task to connect the bridge with the garden; moreover this would be the simplest and cheapest procedure, as I have the necessary planks and tools for the work. I may mention that I have repeatedly disbursed sums in daily wages for the public works department, the paysheets being submitted to the hon. the Commissioner, in whose Department the sums are voted.

The Hon. J. M. Grant &c
Grant decided to meet the Commissioner of Public Works, W. Vale and M on a date to be fixed in the following week to discuss the matter. M was duly informed of Grant's decision and 'Returned with thanks for preliminary arrangements' the file containing his original letter and the annotations on it to the Department of Crown Lands and Survey on 28 June 1867.
